Package ohos.event.notification

Interface IAdvancedNotificationManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IRemoteBroker
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public interface IAdvancedNotificationManager
extends IRemoteBroker
    Provides methods that will be used to publish, subscribe to, unsubscribe from, and cancel notifications during inter-process communication (IPC).
    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Notification#ANS

      • addNotificationSlot

        @Deprecated
void addNotificationSlot​(String bundle,
                         NotificationSlot slot)
                  throws RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a notification slot based on a given application name and NotificationSlot object.

        A NotificationSlot instance cannot be used directly after being initialized. Instead, you have to call this method to create a notification slot and bind the slot ID to a NotificationRequest object so that the notification published can have all the characteristics set in the NotificationSlot.

        After a notification slot is created by using this method, only the name and description of the notification slot can be changed. Changes to the other attributes, such as the vibration status and notification tone, will no longer take effect.

        Parameters:
        bundle - Indicates the application name.
        slot - Indicates the NotificationSlot object to create.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • removeNotificationSlot

        @Deprecated
void removeNotificationSlot​(String bundle,
                            String slotId)
                     throws RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Removes a notification slot based on a given application name and slot ID.
        Parameters:
        bundle - Indicates the application name.
        slotId - Indicates the ID of the notification slot that has been created using addNotificationSlot(java.lang.String,ohos.event.notification.NotificationSlot).
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        1

      • publishNotificationAsBundle

        @Deprecated
void publishNotificationAsBundle​(String bundle,
                                 String representativeBundle,
                                 NotificationRequest request)
                          throws RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Publishes a notification in the name of a specified application bundle. If the notification to be published has the same ID as a published notification that has not been canceled, the existing notification will be replaced by the new one.
        Parameters:
        bundle - Indicates the application name.
        representativeBundle - Indicates the name of the application bundle that allows your application to publish notifications for it by calling setNotificationAgent(java.lang.String,java.lang.String).
        request - Indicates the NotificationRequest object to be published.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • setNotificationAgent

        @Deprecated
void setNotificationAgent​(String bundle,
                          String agent)
                   throws RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Allows another application to act as an agent to publish notifications in the name of your application bundle. You can revoke this authorization by passing null to this method.
        Parameters:
        bundle - Indicates the application name.
        agent - Indicates the name of the application bundle that can publish notifications for your application.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3

      • canPublishNotificationAsBundle

        @Deprecated
boolean canPublishNotificationAsBundle​(String bundle,
                                       String representativeBundle)
                                throws RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        Checks whether your application has permission to publish notifications by calling publishNotificationAsBundle(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,ohos.event.notification.NotificationRequest) in the name of another application indicated by the given representativeBundle.
        Parameters:
        bundle - Indicates the application name.
        representativeBundle - Indicates the name of application bundle your application is representing.
        Returns:
        Returns true if your application can publish notifications for the given representativeBundle; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC exception occurs.
        Since:
        3
